intro: Thyrsanthus gardneri, commonly known as the New Zealand thryanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded inflorescences composed of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, often found in coastal and subalpine regions. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological significance in New Zealand's flora.
